page.title: 05History (2)
page.content: By the wills of William Pepyn and Reginald Lessey of 1562, the first free village school in Suffolk was established in the Guildhall. In 1840 this was transferred to a new school room, now the Church Rooms, and in 1882 to the new Primary School which is still in use. So there has been a continuity of free education since 1562. In 1536 William Treluskant, a great grand nephew of John Tradescant, left money in his will for education and the catechism. The Anchor Inn -now known as the Compasses- was built in about 1680 and bame the centre for village meetings.
